features: QUICK, EVEN HEATING: KitchenAid frying pan has been crafted from stainless steel with an aluminum core base to spread heat quickly and evenly
SILICONE GRIP HANDLES: Dual riveted fry pan handle is finished with a silicone grip to remain cooler while cooking on the stovetop
INDUCTION COMPATIBLE: Large frying pan is designed for use on all cooktops, including induction
EASY TO CLEAN: Durable stainless steel skillet is dishwasher safe for easy cleanup
OVEN SAFE: Stainless steel skillet is oven safe to 400°F to create a wide range of delicious recipes
body.description: Ignite kitchen creativity and experience rich flavor with the KitchenAid Stainless Steel Frying Pan. Crafted from durable stainless steel with a layer of heat-conductive aluminum in the base, this large, versatile fry pan is designed to heat quickly and evenly to cook entrees and sides to perfection. The stainless steel handle has been finished with a silicone grip for a cooler handle while cooking, when compared to traditional stainless steel handles. Dishwasher safe for quick, easy cleanup, induction-suitable, and oven safe to 400°F, this 12-inch frying pan is ideal for making a wide range of delicious recipes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and beautiful pan
reviews.reviewText: It is a good pan. The handle is good quality, does not get heated with the pot, and is helpflu in handling the pan. The pan is made of sturdy, thick layer of material. Has scale engraved on the inner side which is superful helpful in pouring just the right amount into the pan. The spout is another great feature of the pan. Also, have to mention, it does look nice with its great finish. To be honest, this pan at this price is a great buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just Bought my Second One
reviews.reviewText: I love this saucepan so much. It’s the perfect size for a lot of things like heating up soup for one person, melting butter, and so much more. The measurements on the inside are helpful. The handle stays cool. It’s a good quality pan at an affordable price. The best part is the pour spouts on each side. I just bought a second one to keep in our RV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a gift, it looked very good quality and I have seen it on her drying rack, cleaned up very good. She had not complained about it not cooking well, so i am guessing it does, or I would have heard a statement so.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars cooks in 1/2 of time but don't like the steamer pan
reviews.reviewText: I just got these yesterday, January 5, 2024, and immediately through everything in the dishwasher.They came out just fine so they are dishwasher safe.I really like how heavy and solid they feel and the silicone coated handles on the pans and lids are great to get a firm grip on and avoid the heat.I've only used the large frying pan this morning, January 6, 2024 to make my breakfast of a quarter pound sausage pattie, hashbrowns, 2 pieces of French toast, and 2 scrambled eggs.Normally with my old frying pan, I would weigh my sausage and flatten it out and then put it right in the frying pan before turning on the burner. I've figured out that it took 20 minutes for the first side to get done and then flipping it over for 10 minutes for the second side.However, I noticed with this new frying pan, it started burning after 10 minutes and flipped it over and the second side started to burn after 5 minutes so it only took 1/2 of the time to make my sausage pattie.This was a pain because I always had time to wash my potato and shred it for the hashbrowns, get out all the ingredients for the French toast and scrambled eggs before I even needed to flip the sausage pattie but today, I really had to bust my butt to get everything else ready.Grabbing the lid handle was easy with the silicone coating since my old frying pan had a glass lid with a glass handle and the handle would get really hot.Hashbrowns also cooked in 1/2 of the time and they stuck a little bit because I forgot how fast the sausage pattie cooked so the hashbrowns also cooked much faster.The French toast also stuck but only a little but I kept close to them flipping them after 2 minutes.The scrambled eggs also only took about 3 minutes instead of about 5 minutes.Haven't cleaned the large frying pan since it's still hot and wanted to get this out right away.Now, what I don't like about these is the steamer pan because it only fits about 1/3 of the way into the medium sauce pan instead of all the way down. I was really hoping to use it like a strainer for making spaghetti so I didn't need to get the large colander out to drain the spaghetti.I was hoping to boil the spaghetti right in the steamer pan and pull it right out draining all the water at the same time.Other than the steamer pan, I really like the feel, weight, and sturdiness of these pans so far but I've only used the large frying pan and lid. If I have any issues with the other pans, I'll update this and post about them but I'm guessing there won't be any issues since how well the large frying pan did this morning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Nice and sturdy quality stock pot. The rubberized handles keep cool so you don’t need pot holders.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a very functional stockpot, and I particularly like the clear lid so that I can keep an eye on the boiling. I use it regularly and have had no issues with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: Solid, nothing fancy, perfect for my needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to clean, accommodates up to 4 eggs tightly, 3 eggs with more room, and two eggs well .
reviews.reviewText: Cooks quickly and has excellent heat distribution . I made a small frittata with it for openers with peppers, shallots spring onion, with queso blanco and brie cheeses and Serrano ham pieces ;: yummers !Was very easy to clean and wipe out . Glad I bought it to add to my pan collection !Chef Gregory
Me buena combinación entre calidad, precio y marca!!!

Compré este sartén y una batería con sartenes de otra marca. Y este es mi favorito!!!! Buen tamaño, lindo diseño y sabiéndolo usar no se pega nada. Ya se volvió el sartén de cuando hacemos huevos. Y en general de todo cuando necesitamos usar sartén. Estamos muy contentos, ya llevamos varios meses con él.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kitchen Aid pot worth every penny
reviews.reviewText: great product, love our new saucepan
Well built set of pans for my new induction stove. Handles are nice and grippy. Fast shipping too.
It's nice and heavy, good finish and so far finding as long as you start cooking on medium heat, don't warm up as you go, it's reasonably non stick.
